column2: notablefor=leading the [[Vanyar]] in the [[War of Wrath]]

column1: '''Ingwion''' was a son of [[Ingwë]], and a cousin of [[Indis]], the wife of [[Finwë]].
Ingwion led the armed Host of the [[Vanyar]] to the [[Middle-earth]] and the [[War of Wrath]] that overthrew [[Morgoth]] at the end of the [[First Age]].
Ingwion was the captain of the force that landed and captured the haven of [[Eglarest]] in the first battle of the war.
He presumably still lives with his father upon [[Taniquetil]].<ref>{{LR

column2: P2}}</ref> is a compound of the name of his father ''Ingwë'' and the [[Quenya]] patronymic suffix ''[[-ion]]'' which is translated as "Son of Ingwë".

column1: '''Ingil''' (as was his name in the earlier stages of development) was the son of [[Ingwë#Other versions of the legendarium
column2: Inwë]] in the [[The Book of Lost Tales (disambiguation)
column3: Book of Lost Tales]]. He was among the [[Elves]] who came to [[Tol Eressea]]. He rested upon [[Kôr]] with other Elves and built a tall grey tower. The dwelling was called Koromas, but was later known as [[Kortirion]], in memory of their ancient dwelling of Kôr in [[Valinor]] which also upon a hill and had a similar tower.<ref>{{LT1

column1: [[Meril-i-Turinqi]] said that long ago he returned to Valinor and is with [[Manwe]].<ref>{{LT1
column2: In}}</ref> He became a blue bee to follow [[Telimektar]] and is seen among the [[stars]] as [[Nielluin]] (Sirius).<ref>{{LT1

column1: In later versions of the ''Silmarillion'', this character is named '''Ingwiel''' in most of the references, and in at least one instance he is mention to lead the Valinorean [[Noldor]] to the War, instead of [[Finarfin]].<ref>{{LR
column2: P2VI}}</ref> Only in one of his last references his name was altered to '''Ingwion''',<ref>{{WJ
column3: Last}}</ref> which is used in this article.
